Grocery List

This grocery list can help you follow our One-Day Meal Plan and includes all of the ingredients you need to make this month's featured cookbook recipes:

Fresh Produce

  â¡ Arugula – 2 cups

  â¡ Asparagus – 1 bunch

  â¡ Avocado – 1 ripe preferably Hass

  â¡ Basil – 6-8 fresh leaves

  â¡ Blueberries – 1/3 cup

  â¡ Cantaloupe melon – 3/4 cup cubed

  â¡ Cilantro – 2 Tbsp

  â¡ Garlic – 1 head

  â¡ Green pepper – 1 Jalapeno – 1

  â¡ Lemon – 2

  â¡ Lime – 1

  â¡ Onions – 2

  â¡ Red pepper – 1/2 cup

  â¡ Strawberries – 1 heaping cup

  â¡ Tomatoes – 1 medium

Bread and Grains

  â¡ Bread crumbs – 1 1/2 cup

  â¡ Cornmeal yellow or white – 1/2 cup

  â¡ Pearled barley – 2/3 cup cooked

  â¡ Whole-wheat thin crackers – 6 crackers

Dairy and Eggs

  â¡ Fat-free milk – 1/3 cup

  â¡ Feta cheese – 1 oz

  â¡ Reduced-fat cheddar or jack cheese – 1/2 cup

  â¡ Reduced-fat cottage cheese – 1/2 cup

Condiments, Seasonings, Baking Needs

  â¡ Cinnamon Fresh ground pepper

  â¡ Ground chili pepper

  â¡ Ground cumin

  â¡ Ground pepper

  â¡ Olive oil (walnut oil or hazelnut oil)

  â¡ Oregano Red chili flakes

  â¡ Sea salt

Miscellaneous

  â¡ Black beans canned – 1 (16-oz) can

  â¡ Coffee

  â¡ Honey – 2 tsp

  â¡ Low-sodium vegetable broth – 4 cups

  â¡ Pine nuts toasted – 2 Tbsp

  â¡ Raspberry vinegar – 2 Tbsp

  â¡ Slivered almonds – 2 Tbsp

  â¡ White beans – 1 (20-oz) jar

Seasonal Diabetes-Friendly Meals

This month features recipes from The American Diabetes Association Vegetarian Cookbook by Steven Petusevsky. These recipes will please every palate—you don't have to sacrifice great flavor in the name of health.
